frontend-node-dict.title: Frontend node configuration
frontend-node-dict.description: The name used here will be reference of the node, used in the request, so changing it will result with new allocation.

sla-computer_guid.title: SLA Computer GIUD (aka reference) of the node
sla-computer_guid.description: This parameter allows to select to which Compute Node this node will be allocated to. If nothing set, it will be randomly picked up during the alloaction process.

enable-http2.title: Enable HTTP2
enable-http2.description: Enables HTTP2 on the node, defauts to the frontend cluster parameter.

enable-http3.title: Enable HTTP3
enable-http3.description: Enables HTTP3 on the node, defauts to the frontend cluster parameter.

-compat-node-name.title: (Compat) Node name
-compat-node-name.description: The node name for compatiblity, in order for the node to be requested like old style instance reference, quite often like "caddy-frontend-N", where N is the number of the node in old style way. It will override the chosen node title.

certificate-chain.description: SSL Certificate chain to be used. Deprecated, please use master-key-upload-url.
certificate-chain.title: [DEPRECATED] SSL Certificate, with optional CA certificate

domain.description: Domain used to generate automatic hostnames for slaves. For example 'example.com' will result with slave hostname 'slaveref.example.com'.
domain.title: Domain

enable-http2.title: Enable HTTP2
enable-http2.description: Enables HTTP2 by default on each frontend node.

enable-http3.title: Enable HTTP3
enable-http3.description: Enables HTTP3 by default on each frontend node.

http3-port.title: Real advertised HTTP3 port
http3-port.description: As most common deloyment is using iptables for port redirection and in case of udp it is advertising to the process it's bind port instead of the really connected to, it's required to manually set this port for the whole cluster. Can be precisely set on each node by -frontend-i-config-http3-port

re6st-verification-url.description: Url to verify if the internet and/or re6stnet is working.
re6st-verification-url.title: Test Verification URL

backend-connect-timeout.description: Time in seconds for establishing connection to the backend.
backend-connect-timeout.title: Timeout for backend connection (seconds)

backend-connect-retries.description: Amount of retries to connect to the backend. The amount of backend-connect-timeout*backend-connect-retries seconds will be spent to connect to the backend.
backend-connect-retries.title: Amount of retries to connect to the backend.

automatic-internal-kedifa-caucase-csr.description: Automatically signs CSRs sent to KeDiFa's caucase, based on CSR comparison.
automatic-internal-kedifa-caucase-csr.title: Automatic Internal KeDiFa's Caucase CSR

automatic-internal-backend-client-caucas.description: Automatically signs CSRs sent to Backend Client's caucase, based on CSR comparison.
automatic-internal-backend-client-caucas.title: Automatic Internal Backend Client's Caucase CSR

ciphers.title: Ordered space separated list of ciphers
ciphers.default: ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305 ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA AES256-SHA AES128-SHA ECDHE-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA DES-CBC3-SHA

authenticate-to-backend.description: If set to true the frontend certificate will be used as authentication certificate to the backend. Note: backend might have to know the frontend CA, available with 'backend-client-caucase-url'.
authenticate-to-backend.title: Authenticate to backend

ram-cache-size.title: Default size of RAM cache on each node (bytes)
ram-cache-size.description: The value can be provided with suffix 'K', 'M', 'G'

disk-cache-size.title: Default size of disk cache on each node (bytes)
disk-cache-size.description: The value can be provided with suffix 'K', 'M', 'G'
